intro: Lophiolepis × petrakii, commonly known as the hybrid sandmat, is a low-growing succulent native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy leaves and unique floral structures. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically pale yellow or greenish-white. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance, it is often cultivated in rock gardens and xeriscapes.
